definitions.definition: To visit (a person); to pay a call to.
definitions.example: I really should call on my aunt more often.

definitions.definition: To select (a student in a classroom, etc.) to provide an answer.
definitions.example: He sat there, baffled, hoping nobody would call on him.

definitions.definition: (also call upon) To request or ask something of (a person); to select for a task.
definitions.example: The king called on his subjects to take up arms and defend the kingdom.

definitions.definition: (also call upon) To have recourse to.
definitions.example: Exhausted, he called on his last ounce of strength.

definitions.definition: To correct; to point out an error or untruth.
definitions.example: The salesman persisted in quoting a rate higher than was listed, until we called him on it.
